item.title: Flyposting by Christmas tree sellars, 29th November
item.description:
Multiple locations mainly around the forest hill station by traffic lights, on both sides of the station. The Christmas tree sellars have been persistently flyposting and when their boards are removed they return. This has been going on for many years. Can the flyposting be removed and can the council consider prosecuting. They are the tree sellers by the station.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Devonshire Road, Forest Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Invasive plant cuttings need collected, 29th November
item.description:
Invasive bindweed growing on council property has been cut back again by residents to contain it from suffocating nearby trees. The clippings have been cut into smaller pieces to ease collection - waiting for pick up in the carpark.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shrubland Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing skip of household debris, 29th November
item.description:
An overflowing skip full of household debris that is also being used as a public rubbish dumping ground as there are piles of litter and other rubbish (cans, packets, bags) left by the side of the skip. It has been like this for 6+ months
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lower Clapton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Frequent littering, 29th November
item.description:
The top end of Pegwell Street is being frequently littered with fast food, alcohol and fastgas. Please can this end of the street be cleaned and monitored? There are vacant parking spaces at this end of the street better filled by cycle storage, electric charging bays or build outs with street trees as per the Sustainable Streets plan.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Alabama Street, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Advertising strapped to signpost, 29th November
item.description:
I left my home today after noon and by the time I returned a couple hours later I saw this large poster strapped to the pole. When I walked past it and saw the front, I realised it was an advertisement and not a council notice as I'd originally thought. This pole is located on Coptefield Drive in Belvedere. Google Maps coordinates are 51°29'27.9"N 0°07'52.1"E or What3Words ///love.verse.nerve

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coptefield Drive, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Eglinton Hill, Plumstead
